title: England all out for 342, set Australia 160 to win final Ashes Test
byline: Jacob Bethell was finally out for 154 as England were dismissed for 342 before lunch on Thursday, setting Australia 160 to win the fifth and final Ashes Test.

title: Pakistan cruise past Sri Lanka in T20I opener
byline: Pakistan underlined their credentials as serious contenders for the upcoming T20 World Cup with a commanding six-wicket win over Sri Lanka in the opening match of the three-game series in Dambulla on Wednesday.

title: Trump to withdraw US from dozens of UN, international organisations
byline: United States President Donald Trump has announced that he plans to withdraw the US from 66 United Nations and international organisations, including major forums for cooperation on climate change, peace and democracy.

title: Australia win final Test to complete 4-1 Ashes triumph over England
byline: Australia clinched the final Ashes Test against England Thursday by five wickets to complete a dominant 4-1 victory after a gruelling series, sending the retiring Usman Khawaja out on a high.

title: Economic loss from tobacco and alcohol amounts to LKR 241 billion yearly
byline: The Economic loss from consumption of alcohol and tobacco in Sri Lanka amounts to Rs. 241 billion annually which is one-fifth of the total economic loss caused by cyclone Ditwah and 40 percent of the total budget allocated by the government for healthcare, as per the Alcohol and Drug Information Centre (ADIC).

title: SL on high alert as low-pressure area forms in Bay of Bengal, emergency operations ready
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) has placed the country on high alert as a low-pressure area develops in the Bay of Bengal, with emergency operations ready for rescue and evacuation if needed.

title: India reaffirms defence ties during Army Chief’s Sri Lanka visit
byline: Chief of the Army Staff of the Indian Army, General Upendra Dwivedi, paid a courtesy call on Sri Lanka’s Deputy Minister of Defence, Major General Aruna Jayasekara at his office in Colombo yesterday.

title: Government eyes carrying capacity caps and digital ticketing to curb Yala overcrowding
byline: Sri Lanka’s tourism authorities are moving to implement strict carrying capacity limits and a unified digital ticketing system for the national parks, with a primary focus on the Yala National Park, to address the persistent overcrowding issues that threaten the visitor experience.

title: 700 mn women still unbanked globally despite gains in financial inclusion: World Bank
byline: According to the World Bank’s Global Findex 2025 report, across the globe 700 million women are still unbanked and have no access to bank accounts, digital payments, and mobile money services.

title: Monk donates land to support Cyclone Ditwah victims
byline: In support of the government’s rehabilitation programme for those affected by Cyclone Ditwah, a monk, Venerable Mavikande Ratanapala Thera, Chief Incumbent of Siyambalapitiya, Yattogoda and Yatahalena Raja Maha Vihara, Justice of the Peace, and National Director of Human Rights, has donated a ten-acre plot of his privately owned land.

title: ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ housing project to launch tomorrow
byline: The inauguration of the housing project under the ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ initiative, aimed at constructing new homes and providing compensation to those who lost their residences due to Cyclone Ditwah, is scheduled to commence tomorrow (09) in the Anuradhapura and Kurunegala districts.

title: Remaining A/L 2025 exams to be held from Jan 12
byline: The remaining subjects of the 2025 General Certificate of Education Advanced Level (GCE A/L) examination, postponed due to the recent disaster situation, will be conducted from January 12 to January 20, 2026, the Department of Examinations said.

title: Sri Lanka braces for dengue surge amid floods
byline: Sri Lanka is bracing for a renewed dengue surge as cases spike sharply and floodwaters left by Cyclone Ditwah raise fears of fresh outbreaks.

title: Those who killed Lasantha Wickramatunga governed SL years ago: Bimal
byline: Those who killed Sunday Leader Editor Lasantha Wickramatunga governed the nation some years ago, Leader of the House Bimal Rathnayake told Parliament today.

title: Bay of Bengal depression expected to enter Sri Lanka tomorrow
byline: The Department of Meteorology warned that a depression formed in the Bay of Bengal, southeast of Sri Lanka, is likely to intensify into a deep depression within the next 12 hours.

title: 791 cases filed over foreign employment scams – SLBFE
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) said that it has recovered more than Rs. 374 million for victims who filed complaints against individuals and unlicensed employment agencies involved in foreign employment fraud during 2025.

title: Commotion in Parliament over death threats received by MP
byline: Heated arguments rocked Parliament today when Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa and other Opposition MPs sought to raise an issue regarding alleged death threats received by MP Rohana Bandara.

title: No Scope for SL to seek Indian govt. intervention over injection deaths
byline: Sri Lanka has little to no room to seek the involvement of Indian government authorities over the recent deaths of several patients following the administration of an injection, as the purported Indian supplier is a private entity, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Academics, civil society condemn ‘vicious’ hate campaign against PM Harini
byline: A group of academics, professionals and civil society members has strongly condemned what they describe as a vicious smear campaign and personalised attacks targeting Prime Minister and Minister of Education Harini Amarasuriya.

title: Regional cooperation key to overcoming crises in South Asia – Namal Rajapaksa
byline: SLPP MP Namal Rajapaksa said that South Asia needs stronger regional cooperation, with India playing a key role in addressing shared security challenges and ensuring long-term peace and stability in the region.

title: Government ready to give priority to no-confidence motion on Prime Minister: Bimal
byline: The government is ready to give priority in Parliamentary business to the no-confidence motion on Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya as per Standing Orders, Leader of the House Bimal Rathnayake said today.

title: Over 4.4 million students to receive free school uniforms in January
byline: More than 4.4 million students across the country are set to receive free school uniforms in January 2026 under a programme implemented by the Ministry of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education.

title: Ministry clarifies regarding EPF pension scheme
byline: The Ministry of Labour has issued a clarification regarding recent media reports misinterpreting remarks made by Deputy Minister of Labour, Mahinda Jayasinghe, about the Employees’ Provident Fund (EPF).

title: 150mm heavy rain expected in Eastern and North-Central areas
byline: Heavy rainfall exceeding 150 mm is likely at some places in the Eastern Province and in the Mullaittivu, Vavuniya, Kilinochchi and Polonnaruwa districts, following the deep depression in the Bay of Bengal to the southeast of Sri Lanka, the Forecasting Division of the National Meteorological Centre said.

title: Public transport license to be made compulsory for public transport: Bimal
byline: The government is planning to make the public transport license compulsory for public transport in the future, Transport Minister Bimal Rathnayake said today.

title: 43% of drivers caught for traffic offences in Colombo addicted to ICE
byline: A study has revealed that 43 per cent of drivers caught committing traffic offences in Colombo are addicted to ICE, a government MP told Parliament today.

title: Release of Indian actor Vijay’s film Jana Nayagan postponed, disappointing fans in Singapore
byline: The worldwide release of Indian film star Vijay’s much-anticipated movie Jana Nayagan has been postponed, disappointing fans in Singapore who had queued for advance tickets to what is widely thought to be the actor’s final film.

title: Bangladesh to resume direct flights with Pakistan after a decade gap
byline: Bangladesh’s flag carrier will resume direct flights between Dhaka and Pakistan’s largest city Karachi from January 29, restoring non-stop air connectivity between the two countries after over a decade, officials said on Wednesday (January 7, 2026).

title: Cervical cancer: Over 600,000 cases reported globally each year
byline: More than 600,000 cases of cervical cancer are reported worldwide each year, resulting in approximately 340,000 deaths, making it the fourth most common cancer among women globally.

title: Opposition to complain to IMF, World Bank over delay in AG’s appointment
byline: The Opposition is planning to complain to the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and the World Bank over the government’s failure to appoint the long overdue Auditor General, MP Dayasiri Jayasekara said today.

title: Remaining 2025 A/L examination subjects to be held from January 12 to 20
byline: The remaining subjects of the 2025 G.C.E. Advanced Level Examination, which were postponed due to Cyclone Ditwah, will be conducted from January 12 to January 20, the Examinations Department announced.

title: Trump to withdraw US from dozens of UN, international organisations
byline: United States President Donald Trump has announced that he plans to withdraw the US from 66 United Nations and international organisations, including major forums for cooperation on climate change, peace and democracy.

title: Venezuela’s interior minister says 100 people died in U.S. attack
byline: (This Jan 7 story has been refiled to fix the last name of Venezuela’s interim president to Rodriguez, from Rodriquez, in paragraph 4)

title: Mobile drug-testing program begins for public transport drivers
byline: A new drug-testing program for public transport drivers was launched today at the Mattakkuliya depot of the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB), aimed at ensuring a safer, drug-free transport system across the country.

title: Minor tremor recorded in Ududumbara, No cause for alarm
byline: A minor tremor with a magnitude of 2.2 was recorded in the Ududumbara area this evening, the Seismic Data and Tsunami Center confirmed.

title: President appoints Maritime and Supply advisor
byline: Dr. Mahinda Parakrama Disanayake has been appointed as Presidential Advisor on Maritime, Ports, and Supply Affairs, with immediate effect, the President’s Office said.

title: Sri Lanka tightens financial net on terror funding
byline: Sri Lanka has significantly strengthened its national security framework by placing renewed emphasis on Targeted Financial Sanctions (TFS), a critical tool used to disrupt the financing of terrorism and safeguard the country’s financial system, the Ministry of Defence said.

title: Sri Lanka ratifies ILO convention on violence and harassment at work
byline: Sri Lanka formally deposited its instrument of ratification of the International Labour Organization’s (ILO) Convention No. 190 on the elimination of violence and harassment at work this morning at the Labour Ministry auditorium. The event was held under the patronage of Deputy Minister of Labour Mahinda Jayasinghe.

title: Market extends rally on IPO boost
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) extended its upward momentum on Thursday, with both benchmark indices closing firmly in positive territory, supported by renewed investor confidence, strong sector participation, and an exceptional IPO debut.

title: Government to provide disaster loan relief to businesses affected by Cyclone “Ditwah”
byline: The government is taking steps to provide disaster loan relief to small businesses affected by the minor cyclone “Ditwah,” including flower shops, pet shops, incense shops, lottery outlets, and mobile shops.

title: Wattala Pradeshiya Sabha Technical Officer remanded
byline: A Technical Officer attached to the Welisara Sub-Office of the Wattala Pradeshiya Sabha, who is alleged to have solicited and accepted a bribe of Rs. 50,000 to approve a building plan while overlooking its deficiencies, was remanded till 23 January by Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama today.

title: Japan offers electrical engineering jobs to Sri Lankan youth
byline: A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) was signed yesterday (7) at the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE), opening up job opportunities in Japan’s electrical engineering sector for qualified Sri Lankan youth.

title: Surge in fingertip injuries due to motorcycle cleaning, doctors warn
byline: A rising number of injuries to the fingertips of dominant hands have been reported among men while attempting to clean their brand-new motorcycles, Colombo National Hospital’s Plastic and Surgery Department has warned.

title: Deep depression set to slam Sri Lanka; Landslide alerts issued
byline: Sri Lanka is bracing for a high-impact weather event tomorrow night as a deep depression in the Bay of Bengal is forecast to make landfall, triggering torrential rain, landslides, and emergency evacuations, the National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) Director General Eng. (Dr.) Asiri Karunawardena warned.

title: Venezuela’s interior minister says 100 people died in U.S. attack
byline: (This Jan 7 story has been refiled to fix the last name of Venezuela’s interim president to Rodriguez, from Rodriquez, in paragraph 4)
